7050/PC/06/007/001.status_value: With UNICEF support  MoSA developed and launched a new national Social Protection Sector Strategy  which is one of the building blocks of the National Development Plan 2014-2016.  UNICEF also played an instrumental role in the development of the Social Protection component of the State of Palestine's first-ever UNDAF  which has a very strong equity and gender equality focus.
7050/PC/06/007/001.indicator_name: # of line ministry social development papers and plans that include attention to gender-based needs and disparities  prepared in coordination with MOPAD

7050/PC/06/007/001.status_value: As Technical Advisor UNICEF provided high level support to the Social Protection Sector Working Group led by MoSA. UNICEF has also played a key convening role for the UN Theme Group on Social Protection and other key donors such as EU and the World Bank  contributing to improved coordination in the social protection sector.
7050/PC/06/007/001.indicator_name: Number of regularity of social protection forum meetings contributing to effective coordination and providing guidance on gender responsive social policy/protection systems and standards

7050/PC/06/006/002.status_value: 13 Child Protection Networks are operational in WB (11) and Gaza (2)

7050/PC/06/006/002.baseline_value: 2 CPNs in Gaza and 5 CPNs in WB  referred in 2011  14 and 194 children respectively.

7050/PC/06/006/002.status_value: 5 emergency psychosocial teams in Gaza and 11 in the West Bank are better coordinated through the UN Cluster system and with strengthened linkages to MOSA-led Child Protection Networks
7050/PC/06/006/002.indicator_name: Number of Emergency Psychosocial Teams operating in WB and Gaza with strengthened linkages to MOSA-led CPN  providing emergency response for girls and boys  and promoting the prevention of violence  exploitation and abuse.
7050/PC/06/006/002.baseline_value: 5 Emergency Psychosocial Teams in Gaza and 11 in WB  coordinated through the UN Cluster system and the inter-cluster response framework with initial linkages to MOSA-led CPNs.

7050/PC/06/006/002.status_value: The five Psychosocial Support Teams in Gaza reached  59 285 children (boys 52% and girls 48%) and 17 641 caregivers (65% female)    The 21 Family Centers in Gaza reached 76 684 children (53% girls) and 10 087 caregivers (30% male).   The 11 Psychosocial Support Teams in the West Bank reached 19 386 children (50% girls) and 5 663 caregivers (31% male)  The East Jerusalem Project reached 19 501 children  (53% girls) and 3 572 caregivers (24% male)
7050/PC/06/006/002.indicator_name: Number of beneficiaries (disaggregated) of child protection services provided by Psychosocial Teams and Family Centres across Gaza and the West Bank.
7050/PC/06/006/002.baseline_value: In 2009  an estimated 36 000 children and 19 500 caregivers received diverse psychosocial support services in WB and Gaza including through Family Centres  no standardised assessment of psychosocial services.

7050/PC/07/002/004.status_value: Constrained 9: UNICEF and its partners have taken several initiatives to negotiate and ensure a stronger protection of children  including: a) psychosocial support  b) legal assistance  c) advocacy meetings with Israeli MoFA (the Regional Director met with MFA who agreed to engage on CAAC issues)  d) Reports prepared to share with the MFA and continue the dialogue (next report due in January 2016)  e) briefings for international organizations / member states  f) joint efforts with RC/HC and SRSG

7050/PC/06/006/001.status_value: Implementation of MOSA Child Protection Strategic Framework and three year Action Plan  Consultations on the National CP Action Plans are currently on halt anticipating the establishment of the National Council on Children in 2014
7050/PC/06/006/001.indicator_name: Status of National CP Action Plan implementation  including integrated child protection systems across line ministries  monitored by a National Child Protection Committee.
7050/PC/06/006/001.baseline_value: A National Child Protection Action Plan is drafted  informal and fragmented protection systems are in place.

7050/PC/06/006/001.status_value: The Amended Child Law launched and enacted in the   Two relevant by-laws finalized and presented to the Cabinet for endorsement.  The CP referral protocol revised in line with the Amended Child Law  Draft Juvenile Protection Law endorsed by Cabinet and submitted to the office of the President for signature. Juvenile December 2013.   The Juvenile Justice Strategic Framework (JPL) launched
7050/PC/06/006/001.indicator_name: Number of legislative instruments endorsed and implemented by the PA.
7050/PC/06/006/001.baseline_value: Amended Child Law submitted for endorsement by PA. Jordanian and Egyptian JJ laws currently in effect in oPt. Palestinian Juvenile Justice law and relevant documents in draft.

7050/PC/06/006/001.status_value: The Policy of Nonviolence and Discipline in Schools nationally launched on 12 Sep 2013 in (1565)

7050/PC/06/006/001.baseline_value: Endorsed Nonviolence in School Policy and national plan for implementation in place. Draft school protocol ready for piloting.

7050/PC/07/002/001.status_value: On track: Coordination mechanisms function in both Gaza and WB through the CPWG  MHPSS and WGGV.
7050/PC/07/002/001.indicator_name: Level of effective coordination of the national child protection system

7050/PC/07/002/001.status_value: Two by-laws on Foster care and Child Protection Professional Regulations developed and endorsed by the Council of Ministers. The Juvenile Protection law was officially endorsed and a draft Road Map developed for its implementation
7050/PC/07/002/001.indicator_name: Number of child protection related legislation with implementation plans
7050/PC/07/002/001.headline: Outline for a harmonised child protection system finalised across the West Bank and Gaza  Preparations completed for review of social work curriculum in line with international Child Protection standards  Legal and policy framework strengthened with approval of Juvenile protection law  and humanitarian coordination on track through six working groups.

7050/PC/07/002/003.status_value: Alternative to detention network with 12 organisations were established in Bethlehem through support to TDH. TDH and DCI have started to draft guidelines for mediation of children in contact in the law.
7050/PC/07/002/003.indicator_name: Model related to alternative to detention for children in conflict with the law developed
7050/PC/07/002/003.headline: The Juvenile Protection Law (JPL) was approved and the road map for its implementation was endorsed by the National Steering Committee. In Gaza  consensus was reached on the key pillars to improve access to Justice for Children. UNICEF was invited to join the UNDP/UN Women justice and security programme

7050/PC/07/002/003.status_value: On track: 15 FJPUs functioning. UNICEF is working with the relevant SoP Ministries  UN Women and UNDP to support the development of a strategy and SOPs for FJPUs.
7050/PC/07/002/003.indicator_name: Number of Police Family and Juvenile Protecting Units operating according to child and women friendly guidelines
7050/PC/07/002/003.headline: The Juvenile Protection Law (JPL) was approved and the road map for its implementation was endorsed by the National Steering Committee. In Gaza  consensus was reached on the key pillars to improve access to Justice for Children. UNICEF was invited to join the UNDP/UN Women justice and security programme

7050/PC/06/007/003.status_value: A psychosocial assessment of the impact of violence on children following the eight-day escalation of violence in Gaza was published in December 2012  the WASH KAP study was also published in 2012. Three other studies were finalized in 2012 and will be released early 2013: a study on children in military detention  a study on children in detention under the Palestinian Authority and a study on East Jerusalem.
7050/PC/06/007/003.indicator_name: Number of analytical and quantitative studies summarised and reproduced as advocacy documents  with attention to gender dimensions  targeted at the media  general public and policymakers.
7050/PC/06/007/003.baseline_value: Zero studies produced for general audiences in 2009.

7050/PC/06/007/003.indicator_name: Number of key events  within UNICEF's sectoral Programme Component Results  that are supported to highlight sector specific issues related to girls  boys and women's rights in oPt.

7050/PC/06/007/003.status_value: The activities of the UNCT advocacy forum were suspended and passed on to the HCT advocacy forum for the year. UNICEF co-chaired a major press conference on settler violence against civilians  including children  in at-risk areas of the West Bank with OHCHR and the participation  of three NGOs.  Child issues were incorporated to the joint HCT strategy and action plan. The child perspective was included in several reports produced by other UN agencies such as OCHA.
7050/PC/06/007/003.indicator_name: Substantive contributions made to UNCT and HCT advocacy and public information forums to inform the media  general public and policy makers on critical issues related to disparities and vulnerabilities  including gender  of groups within oPt and the Palestinian population at large.

7050/PC/07/003/001.headline: In 2016  the HCYS  MoEHE  UNICEF and its partners promoted civic engagement and entrepreneurial programmes for adolescents: 17 756 (57 per cent females) disadvantaged adolescents developed critical life skills and are better equipped to continue their academic path  to support their communities and enter the labour market.

7050/PC/06/007/002.status_value: 7 completed:  1.	WASH Programme Evaluation 2006-2010 (2013/001) 2.	WASH KAP Study on WASH Practices: WBG Schools  (2013/002) 3.	KAP Study on Adolescents Healthy Lifestyles (2013/003) 4.	Children in Israeli Military Detention (2013/004) 5.	MICS 4 Analytical Report.(2013/005) 6.	Children in conflict with the law under the Palestinian Authority-WBG   7.	Situation Analysis of Palestinian Children (expected to be completed by the end of February 2014)
7050/PC/06/007/002.indicator_name: Number of studies and surveys providing disaggregated data on the situation of girls  boys and women  reflecting disparities and vulnerabilities

7050/PC/06/007/002.status_value: 19 PCBS and line ministry staff trained by PCBS on the use of data in reporting for policy makers using MICS 4/PFS data in 2013. In 2014  the activity was postponed until 2015 as MICS5 data was about to be available.
7050/PC/06/007/002.indicator_name: Number of female and male professionals (PA ministries staff at central and district levels  key stakeholders  policy makers  and academics) who have enhanced skills in gender sensitive socio-economic monitoring and evaluation systems and PalInfo.
7050/PC/06/007/002.baseline_value: 2005-2010: 658 professionals from PCBS  PA  NGOs and UNICEF trained (132 F/ 526 M)

7050/PC/06/007/002.status_value: The National Statistical monitoring System has been launched. It includes a special website where Ministries and the public can access data. Four technical sub committees have been formed by sectors  including line ministries for developing and monitoring indicators of the targeted sectors.
7050/PC/06/007/002.indicator_name: Number of line ministries using the National Monitoring System hosted by PCBS  in a gender aware manner  to track progress towards achievement of national development priorities

7050/PC/06/004/001.status_value: ECD Strategy finalised and  endorsed by  the newly appointed Minister of Education and Higher Education .
7050/PC/06/004/001.indicator_name: Status of Early Childhood Policy Framework

7050/PC/06/004/001.status_value: Contingent on the finalization and endorsement  of the ECD strategy  MoE (West Bank) has identified teachers for 8 of 32 schools. 14 ECD centres (prefab structure) being constructed in Gaza (5 by UNICEF).   Contingent on the finalization and endorsement  of the ECD strategy  Planning in December 2012 to begin training in first quarter of 2013
7050/PC/06/004/001.indicator_name: Percentage of early childhood centres in vulnerable communities applying the established early learning standards
7050/PC/06/004/001.baseline_value: No ECD centres in vulnerable communities applied established early learning standards

7050/PC/06/004/001.indicator_name: Number of ECD supervisors and caregivers trained in and apply MoE early learning standards (disaggregated by gender)
Under the ECD Policy Framework  % of children in communities with poorly performing schools enrolling in kindergarten
7050/PC/06/004/001.baseline_value: National baseline is 36.7% enrolment in kindergarten. Target area baseline unknown

7050/PC/07/004/001.indicator_name: Number of mothers who received counselling on infant and young child feeding
7050/PC/07/004/001.headline: Promotion of exclusive breastfeeding is high on the agenda for the State of Palestine. Early initiation of breastfeeding in maternity wards enabled mothers to establish physical contact with their infant  enhancing mother infant attachment and contributing to early development of the baby

7050/PC/07/004/001.status_value: On track: 91 382 women received counseling on breastfeeding / Infant and Young Child Feeding (IYCF) awareness through community and facility based awareness raising sessions.

7050/PC/07/004/002.indicator_name: Newborns receiving postnatal care within two days of birth
7050/PC/07/004/002.headline: Newborn mortality reduction is a national priority  including integrated child health care services for children aged 0-8 years. The State of Palestine joined the global initiative `Every Woman  Every Child' and the Ministry of Health developed a National Early Newborn Action Plan  with support from UNICEF  WHO and UNFPA.

7050/PC/07/004/002.status_value: On track: 605 doctors and nurses have enhanced neonate care skills  through joint training with partners (MOH  NECC and UHWC)

7050/PC/07/004/003.status_value: Met: 99% coverage as per EPI schedule.
7050/PC/07/004/003.headline: Palestine maintained a high immunization rate (99 per cent) and identified areas for improvement in relation to multi-year planning  updating the immunization policy  effective vaccine management and cold chain capacity  as well as securing funds for the procurement of vaccines.
